document: The provided file covers binary trees and binary search trees, their traversals (inorder, preorder, postorder), time complexity of operations on BSTs, and basic graph concepts such as directed vs undirected graphs and adjacency list representation.

questions.question: Which node in a binary tree has no children?
In a binary search tree, the value of any node's right child is:
options: Greater than or equal to its parent

questions.question: Which traversal prints the values of a binary search tree in ascending order?
During an inorder traversal, which node is processed first for a node with left subtree only?
What is the time complexity of inserting an item into a balanced binary search tree?
Which operation on a BST has worst-case time complexity of O(n) in an unbalanced tree?
In an undirected graph, an edge (u,v) is represented as:
Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of a binary tree?
options: Each node has at most two children
Each node may have zero, one, or two children
The root node contains no data
questions.answer: The root node contains no data

questions.question: Which of the following is a property of a binary search tree?
options: Left subtree values are always greater than parent
Right subtree values are always less than parent

questions.question: What is the correct sequence of a preorder traversal for the tree in the example file?
In a binary tree, the root node is:
options: The first node in the tree
questions.answer: The first node in the tree

questions.question: Which traversal processes the node itself before its children?
An array-based linear list supports which of the following operations in O(1) time?
Which of the following is a correct description of an adjacency list for a graph with n vertices and e edges?
options: n head nodes and 2e list nodes
n head nodes and e list nodes
2n head nodes and e list nodes
n+e head nodes and e list nodes
questions.answer: n head nodes and 2e list nodes

questions.question: In a binary search tree, which node value is guaranteed to be the smallest?
options: Any node with no left child

questions.question: Which traversal visits a node after its two children in a binary tree?
A graph G = (V,E) is composed of:
Which of the following statements about a binary search tree's depth is correct?
options: Depth is always equal to log₂n
Depth is the sum of left and right subtree depths

questions.question: In a binary tree, what is the maximum number of nodes that can be stored in a level?
Which of the following is NOT an operation that can be performed on a linked list?
